Located in the heart of Bangkok, Siam Center isnt just a mallits a cultural experience that seamlessly blends fashion, art, and technology. From the moment I stepped inside, I was struck by the centers chic and avantgarde design. Every corner of the mall exudes a sense of creativity and innovation, with stunning installations and art pieces that make you feel like youre walking through a contemporary gallery rather than a traditional shopping complex. The ambiance is further enhanced by the clever use of lighting and open spaces, creating an inviting atmosphere thats both dynamic and relaxed. The retail offerings at Siam Center are nothing short of impressive. Whether youre a fashion enthusiast, techsavvy shopper, or simply looking for unique souvenirs, the variety of stores caters to all tastes. International luxury brands sit comfortably alongside trendy local designers, offering a curated selection that reflects Bangkoks status as a global fashion hub. I found myself particularly drawn to the boutique stores that showcase emerging Thai designerseach piece felt like a oneofakind treasure. Foodies will also find Siam Center to be a culinary paradise. The mall features an eclectic range of dining options, from gourmet restaurants to cozy cafes, each offering a delightful array of international and local cuisine. During my visit, I indulged in some of the best Thai street food Ive ever tasted, all within the comfort of this stylish setting. The attention to detail in both presentation and flavor was truly remarkable, making for a memorable dining experience. What sets Siam Center apart from other shopping destinations is its commitment to innovation and sustainability. The mall incorporates cuttingedge technology in its services, ensuring a seamless shopping experience. Additionally, its focus on sustainability is evident through various ecofriendly initiatives, which is a refreshing sight in todays retail landscape. In conclusion, Siam Center is more than just a shopping destinationit' s a vibrant showcase of Bangkoks modern identity. Whether youre visiting for the first time or returning as a seasoned traveler, this mall offers something new and exciting with every visit. I highly recommend adding Siam Center to your Bangkok itinerary. Its a place where creativity, culture, and commerce collide, leaving you inspired long after youve left its stylish halls.

This is one of the best places to buy souvenirs and chocolates if you are leaving Thailand after a vacation. You can find a wide variety of products here at prices that are often cheaper compared to other markets. Bargaining is an option to reduce the price of any product you purchase, but most wholesale shops do not encourage it. It is advisable to check with multiple shops before buying a product, as different shops sell the same product at different prices. You might find that some shops on the first floor sell the same products as those on the ground floor at even cheaper prices. By comparing prices across several shops, you can ensure you get the best deal. If you plan to buy electronic products, make sure to check whether your flight allows you to carry the battery in your checkedin luggage. If batteries are not permitted in checked luggage, you can carry them in your cabin or hand luggage. This is an important consideration to avoid any issues at the airport. Additional information Dont plan to visit the shop in the evening, as almost every shop here closes by 8 PM. Allocate at least half a day to explore all the shops and another half day to make your purchases. Keep in mind that you wont find any original branded products here most items sold are duplicates, first copies, or unbranded. Despite this, the variety and affordability make it a worthwhile shopping experience for tourists looking to bring home gifts and mementos. To make the most of your shopping experience, arrive early and take your time exploring. The market offers an extensive range of items, and careful browsing can lead to some great finds. Whether you are looking for traditional Thai crafts, unique souvenirs, or delicious chocolates, this market has something for everyone.

A really excellent option in Bangkok. The facilities are great and the staff are really on the ball. They' ve recently upgraded their internet services so now there is one single tier for all users which is great. The gym is fantastic and the pool is awesome, I just wish these both stayed open later or were 24 hours. The breakfast is decent, with a changing daily menu set. The rooms are spacious and have comfortable beds. The shower water pressure can be a little weak but not unusable. I' d definitely stay here again next time.
Overall, we had a very good experience at the Pathumwan Princess hotel. The hotel has recently undergone an internal makeover which makes it feel very uptodate and spacious. Even the hallways are well lit with the carpet a nice soft touch to your feet after a long day of walking. Not sure if it' s because we had the 2bedroom family room, but the rooms felt large and very comfortable. The filtered water was a bit of a head challenge to trust I agree with the approach of reducing waste but it' s the first hotel we have come across that provided essentially drinking water via tap and I' d like to see displayed in the rooms the frequency of testing and results etc. in order to properly trust it. That being said I did try it, and I was fine. We used the pool area a couple of times and that was quite nice although a bit out of date. I feel the hotel doesn' t cater for children very well. There is no playroom much like the other hotels we stayed and no child friendly pool areas. This could be improved if the hotel wanted to attract more families although this may not be of interest as the location no doubt attracts plenty of other people to stay there. I thought breakfast had good variety and the staff at breakfast were friendly. The standout for me was the waffles they were the best we had on the holiday. We had a package with club benefits which we enjoyed 3 of the 4 nights we stayed. I liked the club lounge I felt the food on offer was hit and miss but others enjoyed the food on nights I didn' t. The staff were very good at the lounge. I didn' t like the location of the lounge it felt like a mission to find it but again the staff were friendly and showed us the way. I believe the club lounge package is good value for money and I would book that again if I decide to return.
Our stay at Pathumwan Princess Hotel was fantastic! The location was perfect, and the service was topnotch. The room was spotless, and the housekeeping staff did an outstanding job throughout our stay. We had a minor issue with the airconditioning, but the engineers arrived within 10 minutes and resolved it quickly. Overall, we had a great experience and would highly recommend this hotel!
